intro: Tristemma montanum, commonly known as mountain tristema, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits that contain several seeds. Tristemma montanum is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
